title: NVIDIA Secures Entire TSMC 3nm Capacity for 2025
content: Reports indicate NVIDIA has prepaid for 100% of TSMC's available N3 production capacity through Q4 2025, effectively blocking competitors from large-scale 3nm access.

title: Apple Acquires AI Startup 'NeuroCore' for $2.1B
content: Apple has finalized the acquisition of NeuroCore, a specialist in on-device LLM optimization. The technology is expected to be integrated into the A19 Pro chip.

title: Intel 18A Yields Below Targets, Delaying Arrow Lake Refresh
content: Internal memos suggest Intel's 18A process node is achieving only 40% yield for high-performance cores, pushing the Arrow Lake Refresh launch to mid-2026.

title: AMD Announces MI400X with 288GB HBM3e
content: AMD officially unveiled the MI400X accelerator, featuring 288GB of HBM3e memory and claiming 1.5x inference performance over NVIDIA's H200.

title: Google Shifts TPU v6 Production to Samsung Foundry
content: In a surprise move, Google has signed a multi-year agreement with Samsung Foundry to manufacture its next-gen TPU v6 chips using the SF2 process.

title: Meta Unveils 'Llama 5' 700B Model
content: Meta has open-sourced Llama 5, a 700B parameter model trained on 50T tokens. Benchmarks show it outperforming GPT-5 in coding tasks.

title: TSMC Arizona Fab 2 Begins Risk Production
content: TSMC's second fab in Arizona has started risk production of 4nm wafers, six months ahead of the revised schedule.

title: NVIDIA Blackwell B200 Ultra Shipping to Hyperscalers
content: First batches of NVIDIA's B200 Ultra GPUs have been spotted in shipping manifests destined for Microsoft and AWS data centers.

title: Apple Cuts Vision Pro 2 Production Forecast
content: Citing supply chain constraints on micro-OLED displays, Apple has reduced its 2026 production target for Vision Pro 2 by 30%.

title: Intel Foundry Services Signs MediaTek for 18A
content: Intel Foundry has secured a strategic partnership with MediaTek to manufacture smart edge devices using the Intel 18A process.

title: AMD Gains 5% Server Market Share in Q3
content: Latest market analysis shows AMD EPYC processors now command 38% of the x86 server market, a 5% increase year-over-year.

title: Google Expands Iowa Data Center for AI Workloads
content: Google plans to invest an additional $1B in its Iowa data center complex to support liquid-cooled racks for next-gen AI training clusters.

title: Meta Orders 150,000 H200 GPUs
content: Supply chain sources confirm Meta has placed a new order for 150,000 NVIDIA H200 GPUs to bolster its Llama training infrastructure.

title: TSMC 2nm Yields Exceed 80%
content: TSMC reports that its N2 process node yields have surpassed 80%, paving the way for mass production in late 2025.

title: NVIDIA Q3 Earnings Beat Expectations by 20%
content: NVIDIA reported Q3 revenue of $45B, beating analyst expectations by 20%, driven by insatiable demand for data center GPUs.
